iiv.display

Class CNUContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • iiv.display.CNUContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ShowPointDialog.ShowPointContainer

    public class CNUContainer
extends Container
implements MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ActionListener
    This is a basic display container window for iiV.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUViewer, Container, Serialized Form

      • getEventPointOnScreen

        public Point getEventPointOnScreen(MouseEvent evt,
                                   boolean start)
        Gets the location of an mouse event relative to the screen based on the current drag event positioning mode. This routine is needed because this container may reposition components or itself during drag operations. Does not work on all platforms. And no way to determine which mode of operation is best for current platform.
        Parameters:
        evt - mouse event
        start - should be true if this is the initial call generated by a mouse press
        Returns:
        location of mouse event relative to the screen

      • setDragEventPositioningMode

        public void setDragEventPositioningMode(int mode)
        Sets the drag event positioning mode. Because of inconsistencies across platforms, this flag is needed to specify how to calculate the position of an mouse event on the screen during a drag.
        Parameters:
        mode - new drag event positioing mode (EVENT_RELATIVE_TO_START_COMPONENT_ON_SCREEN or EVENT_RELATIVE_TO_COMPONENT_ON_SCREEN)

      • getDragEventPositioningMode

        public int getDragEventPositioningMode()
        Gets the drag event positioning mode. Because of inconsistencies across platforms, this flag is needed to specify how to calculate the position of a mouse event on the screen during a drag.
        Returns:
        drag event positioing mode (EVENT_RELATIVE_TO_START_COMPONENT_ON_SCREEN or EVENT_RELATIVE_TO_COMPONENT_ON_SCREEN)

                                    Point scrollPosition)
        Changes the scroll position by the givent amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount to scroll by
        scrollPosition - starting scroll position to change by amount if null uses current position
